html: 4.2.23  3:22 pm   i've made a breakthrough. i've been trying to learn guitar because i want to make music but don't have a keyboard or functional piano. i've learned it just by messing around and i am finding a lot of useful chords. it's very pleasant to make chords and pretty tunes even though i have no clue what is going on. without getting too philosophical, i think i can apply this theory to life. i'm not very good at life, but if i can discover new things, and learn to appreciate existing things, i have plenty of material to work with. :)

3.31.23  5:40 pm   Do you think that a chord such as Dmaj7/E , where the supertonic

     of the maj7 chord is in the base,

     suggests a minor voicing of the supertonic E in this case.

     I ask because I noticed that a few of the notes found in the Dmaj7 chord are played in your "money" vamp at the end specifically on the E minor dorian chord , and after improving over it myself using a lot of dmaj7 I found that it has a similar sort of sound.
